page.title: 03RYDE CANOE LAKE
page.content: Ryde Canoe Lake was constructed in about 1882. At the western end is a{cafe.}Next to this is are the{Esplanade Swimming {Pools.}There is a paddling pool, a learner pool and a 25m main pool (Max. depth 2m). It is open air but surrounded by a sheltering wall. In the centre section is{Ryde Boating {Lake.}Motor boats, splashcats, rowing boats, canoes and paddle boats can be hired. The most expensive are the motor boats at 95p for 5 minutes. The eastern section of water is used by{Ryde Model Yacht Club}which was formed in 1874 and has a present membership of 25 who race their radio-controlled Marblehead yachts every Sunday morning from March to December. At the eastern end is an open {paddling pool. }
